entry.title: Strawberry Waffles
entry.summary:
Author: lushescape

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 41,076Chapters: 15/?Kudos: 657

Summary: “Like a date?” You ask in a near whisper. Jason looks like he's been electrocuted but slowly he nods his head twice. “Yeah. A date. You and me, the school dance.” Oh. Your heart feels like it's beating so fast it's going to stop at any second. But you nod, your face warm, and there's no way you can stop yourself from smiling now. “Um, y- yeah.” You stammer before clearing your throat softly. “Yes.” You say, more confident in your answer. “Yes, I would.. love to go with you. On a date. To the dance.” Or Jason Todd becomes a girl dad after dying and coming back to life

entry.title: Baby’s First Creature-Feature
entry.summary:
Author: TheGoldenPath

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 24,019Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 39

Summary: She’s reading to him, a generator manual that looks well read. The pages are yellow and water stained around her long fingers. His vision lazily trails from the book to his bloodied sheets and back to the stranger. Is he hallucinating a comforting presence to make his reality less burdensome? When had his visions ever been pleasant?A pretty girl to sit by his bedside and comfort him in his death. It reminds him of the soft moments of peace in his childhood that he held onto with a white knuckled grip. It reminds him of the few moments his mother felt like a mother. He tries to reach out and touch her hand, just to see if she’s a fantasy meant to remind him of everything he never fully had only for the pain to jolt up his entire abdomen. That works too. He manages to stifle the pained groan that wants to shoot out from the simple motion.   Lightly inspired by the myth of Circe in the odyssey. (Lightly)

entry.title: The Star that Wouldn't Die
entry.summary:
Author: ShadDork

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 74,779Chapters: 18/29Kudos: 521

Summary: Jason Todd forgot a lot of things after the lazarus pit's putrid green waters helped restore him back to life. Most of it was unimportant information, things that he didn't need to worry about, after all, he could always relearn names, smells, and re-read books. Lost memories weren't as easy to deal with the loss of, but he could always make new ones. The memories that remained were largely traumatic, and the others were slowly being uncovered as time passed.He wished that Dick hadn't said that name, your name. Reigniting feelings and memories. Guilt was already a large part of his existence, and this new guilt about forgetting you entirely was just making everything worse. He shouldn't track you down in case it accidentally put you in danger. But he wanted to make sure that you were okay. It was a battle he lost against himself.As memories he thought were long lost start to return, can he continue to be in your life without dragging you down with him? Can he be in your life without you knowing who he is? He doesn't know, but he wants to try.

entry.title: The Bloom Knot
entry.summary:
Author: nocteris

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,383Chapters: 6/22Kudos: 59

Summary: “I suggest we ignore that it happened.” Your jaw physically dropped, “what?” “You got any soul marks on you?” You had already checked a million times, but you still removed your gloves to show him. Both ring fingers clean, you flexed them in his direction. “Same here,” he waved his already bare hands, clean as day. “So, we forget it ever happened unless some strange shit happens.” ——— Where you and Jason accidentally trigger the curse of soulmates— a curse that binds you to the first person you touch hands with. The plan was simple, to avoid each other. There was no way you—a STEM major, would cross paths with him anyway. So, what the hell were you doing in his Comparative Literature 121 lecture hall?

entry.title: Apartment 3B
entry.summary:
Author: ElaineInABox

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,044Chapters: 11/15Kudos: 492

Summary: You weren’t looking for love, just somewhere cheap, quiet, and safe enough to get you through the semester. Jason Todd wasn’t looking for company, just a roommate who wouldn’t ask questions about why he came home at two AM bloody and bruised.But in a cramped apartment in Crime Alley, between burnt coffee, leaky ceilings, and the soft hum of the city that never sleeps, the silence between you starts to change. What begins as survival becomes something quieter, steadier—something that almost feels like home.
